Title: Shell takes FID on Manatee gas field to backfill Atlantic LNG
Description: Shell has made a final investment decision on the Manatee gas field offshore Trinidad and Tobago which will backfill the existing 15.3 mtpa Atlantic LNG export plant as the firm looks to boost its LNG business.
Author: JS

Title: Bulgargaz starts arbitration against Gazprom over gas supplies
Description: Bulgarian state gas company Bulgargaz EAD has started arbitration proceedings against Russia's Gazprom Export, seeking compensation of EUR400 million ($432.5 million) for the suspension of contractual supplies in 2022.
Author: JS

Title: Glencore inks LNG supply deal with Shenzhen Energy
Description: China's Shenzhen Energy Group has signed a long-term sales and purchase agreement to buy LNG from with Switzerland-headquartered trader Glencore.
Author: JS

Title: Switzerland’s MET Group seals 10-year LNG deal with Shell
Description: Swiss energy firm MET Group has signed a 10-year agreement to buy LNG from Shell, with an eye to supplying its European customers with US LNG.
Author: CK

Title: POSCO International completes construction of Gwangyang LNG, to bring second LNG terminal online in 2026
Description: POSCO International, South Korean steelmaker POSCO’s trading arm, has completed the construction of the 5.2 mtpa Gwangyang, the country’s first privately owned LNG import terminal. It said that its second facility is due to come online in 2026.
Author: JS

Title: LNG Canada’s Train 1 approaches completion ahead of targeted mid-2025 start of LNG exports
Description: The first liquefaction train of the 14 mtpa LNG Canada project in Kitimat, British Columbia, has moved closer to completion ahead of the anticipated start of LNG deliveries in mid-2025 thanks to the completion of the train’s final weld by the JGC-Fluor engineering joint venture.
Author: CK

Title: Summit LNG FSRU heading back to Bangladesh after repairs at Singapore’s Seatrium shipyard
Description: The 138,000 m3 Summit LNG floating storage regasification unit has left the Seatrium Tuas shipyard in Singapore and is making its way to Chittagong, Bangladesh, to resume LNG import operations by mid-month at the Summit floating LNG terminal.
Author: CK
